title: UTF-8 Cyrillic / Slavonic / Slavic

metadata.description: Learn about UTF-8 Cyrillic / Slavonic / Slavic with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Cyrillic is the alphabet used for Russian, Bulgarian, Serbian, Ukrainian, and other Slavic languages. The Cyrillic script was created during the First Bulgarian Empire. It is derived from Greek uncials and is the alphabet used by the Orthodox Church. Example

I will display Ё

I will display Ё

Will display as: I will display Ё I will display Ё Cyrillic Basic Hex 0400-04FF / Decimal 1024-1279 Char Dec Hex Name Ѐ 1024 0400 CAPITAL LETTER IE WITH GRAVE Ё 1025 0401 CAPITAL LETTER IO Ђ 1026 0402 quiz.question:
What is Slavic

Cyrillic?
options: the alphabet used by the Orthodox Church
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Slavic

Cyrillic is 'the alphabet used for Russian'.

quiz.question: What is It is derived from Greek uncials and?
options: the alphabet used by the Orthodox Church
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of It is derived from Greek uncials and is 'the alphabet used by the Orthodox Church'.

summary: This tutorial covers UTF-8 Cyrillic / Slavonic / Slavic concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use UTF-8 Cyrillic / Slavonic / Slavic effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of UTF-8 Cyrillic / Slavonic / Slavic and how to apply it in your projects.
